intro: Cuviera angolensis subsp. angolensis, commonly known as the Angola cupuaçu, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of southern Africa, particularly Angola. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and produces a yellowish-orange fruit with a sweet, creamy pulp. The fruit is often used in local cuisines and has potential for commercial cultivation. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological and agricultural studies.
